metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11708 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient vetting of parameters passed with the Prompt:Open IPC message between child and parent processes can result in the non-sandboxed parent process opening web content chosen by a compromised child process. When combined with additional vulnerabilities this could result in executing arbitrary code on the user's computer. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.7.2, Firefox < 67.0.4, and Thunderbird < 60.7.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11708` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 67.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 67.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> scripting is disabled in thunderbird
